summary: Rati wrapped up the year with a nearly 1,700-line bang in *Orchard*, perfecting the sync engine with shadow state and making sure the exhaustive architecture docs matched the new reality.
Rati executed a 53,000-line architectural demolition in GSIP, implementing a modular Reporter System and building robust, OOM-proof multi-temporal data pipelines from the ground up.
Targeting the GeoTiff Scalable Analysis Pipeline, Rati performed significant surgery, adding 118 lines and deleting 68 to finally squash those nagging geospatial processing bugs.

Rati executed a massive refactor, renaming his GeoTiff pipeline to the general-purpose `eo_core`, integrating Prithvi segmentation, and significantly upgrading GPU memory heuristics for scalable EO inference.
He committed a significant overhaul to `rvardiashvili/portfolio`, ensuring buttery-smooth window scrolling, fixing pesky 404s, and adding a classic Snake game plus a Konami code party trick.
Rati just air-dropped a monster commit (+1471 lines!) on his geospatial pipeline, making it model-agnostic and giving it PhD-level memory auto-calculation to handle massive GeoTiffs efficiently.
Rati was busy teaching his portfolio how to boast, churning through 1844 lines to deploy an AI-powered activity timeline, even while refactoring the GeoTiff pipeline to use Hydra.
